Articles.Content:
I've noticed KSP isn't very colorblind friendly. I've noticed friends and streamers alike have no clue that the orbital lines were different colors. This may seem not so much a big deal but Squad clearly made them different for a reason, colorblind people shouldn't be left out.

My suggestions,

-Add an option for colorblind mode that turns the lines into a grey scale (I believe colorblind people can tell different shades of grey?)

-Change the projected orbital path to a dashed line instead of solid to have a more visual difference rather than just the color.

Posted as discussion because I'm not colorblind and would like to hear what everyone thinks.

-Marcuzzi
There are certain color combinations they can use that can be seen by almost every type of colorblindness. At least that's what I infer from other colorblind settings in games.

I saw the above post and remembered reading this post at a different thread about programming / developing for colorblindness.

https://community.devexpress.com/blogs/markmiller/archive/2009/02/26/great-ui-clarity-and-color-on-the-presentation-layer.aspx

Its a good read for anyone in development.
